author: Hugo Long
text: 'This spot never fails to impress. They have awesome food for convenient pricing
column5: there are no long waits even when they are packed.'

author: Joel Robles Bustamante
text: 'The food food here is awesome recommend people coming here for the first time trying Turkish food like pitta bread and falafelüòãor rice with Kebab!!'

author: Michael McElroy
text: 'I had a great experience at this place. We enjoyed the great atmosphere and the meals. The staff were super attentive. I am glad we ultimately managed to try this place.'

author: Danny Johnson
text: 'The food is constantly well prepared and yummy
column5: staff members provides excellent customer service. I liked the cleanliness and ambience. Will visit here again.'

author: Frank F
text: 'Love flatbread. Solid delivery spot. Order a couple of times a week. Fresh and consistent. Their favorite platter special is great.'

author: matt marsh
text: 'i love flatbread grill so much this is the best restaurant chicken pesto'

author: Marissa D
text: 'Love the chicken hummus pita and chicken chipotle flatbread!'

author: Bernard Orr
text: 'I actually like their food and service
column5: awesome area next to where I live. The staff members are always super friendly. Will come back again.'

author: Elvis Jimenez
text: 'I was overwhelmed by all the flavors I recommend the original platter very filling'

author: Erika
text: "I was in love with the one in jersey city and am extremely sad that it closed. So when I went on the website and saw that the Hoboken location was delivering I hoped right on it. After an hour I received a phone call saying that I should check my locations before ordering and that they do not deliver to jersey city and that I can to come and pick up my order. Unfortunately due to my job that was impossible and was the reason as to why I clicked on delivery. I had no problem with this and asked if I could just have a refund. The young lady refused to let me speak to a manager and said she didn‚Äôt know any of them. She was extremely rude and on top of that I went without lunche and still got charged. Highly disappointed with the customer service and the ordering system. If you only deliver to Hoboken that should be stated.\n\nSomeone makes a comment and you feel harassed. If that‚Äôs the case you should just close. And don‚Äôt use another country's turmoil as a poor excuse for the way you treat your customers. You would never understand what they are going through."

author: Bitter Sweet
text: "The food is good
column5: but the customer service and staff look miserable! I have been there 3 times now and everyone has a very very bad attitude. Management
column6: please work on better staffing as you might be losing many customers because people do not want to deal with your staff's attitude."

author: Hazel Chinique
text: 'good food. lacks nut allergy friendly options though.'

author: David Horowitz
text: 'Really good chicken
column5: a nice lunch spot.'

author: Andrew ‚ÄúWoodyWilson‚Äù Hughes
text: 'These reviews are mostly faked. The food was old and not prepared fresh. Will not come back.'

author: CurlsnPearlsss
text: 'Falafel pita pocket was ok but it was overly drenched in sauce (yogurt cucumber and red hot) which was way too tangy. It made the bread completely soggy and I was unable to eat half of it. Staff is not friendly. Will not return.'

author: Maddie
text:
'Employees are unnecessarily rude. Food isn‚Äôt anything special and overpriced. Not worth it.

Editing to respond:

I have never been to the location and Montclair
column5: starting eating here when Hoboken location opened up. Customer service has increasingly declined as you can see here.'

author: Stephanie Escobar
text: 'Employees either need to cheer up or just add more love into making these sandwiches
column5: my chicken pesto sandwich wasn‚Äôt good. Chicken was burnt.\nNo greeting when walking in nor while standing at register.\nAlso
column6: not their fault but sodas out of service- a few sandwiches were out of stock. Horrible'

author: Lakeisha Jackson
text: 'Refused to change my salad manager is rude never returning'

author: Brett Hladczuk
text: "When I first heard of this place
column5: I was surprised
column7: that it was not just a specialty flatbread pizza joint. This disappointment faded quickly when the first fork-full of shepard's salad blessed my tastebuds. 2 years of rehab later
column8: I was finally able to get completely clean and quit shepard's salad for good. Oh
column9: and the rest of the food is great

author: Amahl Cain
text: 'Excellent!'

author: pouria babvey
text: 'I used to go there once a while. Recently I noticed they don‚Äôt service the tap water. I don‚Äôt feel good to go there anymore. Beside
column5: the gradually decrease the food portion. The quality is getting worse and worse there.'

author: Faisal Aleissa
text: 'The worst customer service ever she had a very bad attitude and she had closed the phone on me while I was talking
column5: try to avoid while you can'

author: Ryan Gilmartin
text: 'Just called to place just for delivery.  "Umm can you do it online? I\'m busy".\n\nDecided to order somewhere else so this 1 star is based solely on the customer service.'

author: Malcolm McDaniel
text: "I will never order here or recommend it to anyone I know ever again. First
column5: when the food was delivered
column6: they forgot three orders of fries. When I called the store to inform them of this
column7: the woman that picked up first insisted that we did have the fries. After informing her again that we didn't receive them
column8: she said we would need to wait because they delivery driver had other orders. Second
column9: I received a Dr.Pepper and a Half and Half Lemonade when I asked for a Sprite. I originally wanted a Minute Maid Lemonade
column10: and the same woman called to tell me that they didn't have that so I asked for a Sprite which she said was fine. After calling about the Sprite
column11: she first hung up on me! After calling back and stating that she hung up on me
column12: the same woman rudely stated that she didn't hang up she placed me on mute and proceeded to yell at me as I inquired about the Sprite which resulted in her rudely hanging up again. Thirdly
column13: I asked for a sandwich with no onions for allergies reasons and received a sandwich with onions. Luckily I spoke to a different woman and she was so kind to send me a new sandwich (S/O to Gigi!) Odd thing was when the delivery person brought the sandwich
column14: he asked to trade the sandwich I did have which I have never heard of before. There's plenty of other options
column15: and I will never waste my time dealing with them again. One of the worst experiences I have had ordering food ANYWHERE!"

author: Kathleen Budny
text: 'Four stars cause the food is decent and there aren‚Äôt many great choices in the immediate area. But they seem to forget something from your order each time
column5: whether it‚Äôs sauce

author: Georgie Murray
text: 'Poor customer service. Flatbread over cooked and made with an attitude. Pot luck on whether you receive great service or bad. Shame as has a lot of potential. Got a concealed lump of milk in my iced latte also.'

author: Amy Bernard
text: 'Placed an order on seamless that they completely messed up. They told me I could request a refund through seamless but they wouldn‚Äôt redeliver. When I told the person on the phone I was not satisfied with that (because I still needed to eat - and btw this is 1.5 hours before they close) she literally said ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù.\n\nEditing to respond: I called 5 minutes after I received the order when I opened the bag and it was apparent the bowl was missing more than half the ingredients. Yes
column5: I received the item - it had a scoop of hummus and some sad veggies (no beets
column7: feta cheese as described). I did not want free food - I wanted the food I ordered and paid for. And you absolutely said ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù and hung up on me when I said I wanted the item I paid for delivered. Nice response though - a continuation of your stellar customer service.'

author: Alfredo Rainuzzo
text: 'Outstanding place owned by the Esendimir Sisters
column5: great food you must try

author: Scott Molnar
text: 'Cancelled my order - second time this happened. Claimed I am outside their delivery area. I live 5 blocks from the restaurant. Awful company and service.'

author: Robert M
text: 'Great for lunch'

author: Maria Lopez Cavestany
text: 'The fries here are amazing!!!'

author: shoeb khan
text: 'its the best place to be ever in..!!!'

author: Steven Hoffenson
text: "Good food
column5: though it's a bit overpriced for what it is. Prices went up recently

author: Michael Rodriguez
text: 'Very clean staff very polite'

author: Joe
text: 'Flatbread Grill has great food most of the time.  The service is okay.\n\nOn busy days when the staff are turning over a lot of orders
column5: it is easy for them to be swept into the rush and not put out quality product.  My Chicken Chipotle Flatbread was burned on the bottom
column6: and they gave me a "for here" container even though I specified that I wanted it "To go."\n\nThe staff take a long time to take your order
column7: and can take even longer to get your food out
column8: which isn\'t necessarily because the food is basically made to order.\n\nFlatbread grill has great food
column9: but stay away from it when they are busy
column10: or you will wait 3x longer than you should and the food will be either great or not-so-great.'

author: Gregory Visconti
text: 'Fresh
column5: healthy and tasty food every time!'

author: Kennesha Forson
text: 'My food was prepared fresh and it was very tasty.'

author: Fernando G√≥mez
text: "I highly recommend the meat on top of the salad. The chicken sandwich with cheese wasn't good.\nThe spicy sauce was delicious."

author: Yuly C.Rey
text:
'Service is great  the guy was very helpfull and patient.
Was order took a bit to come out but was worthy cuz chicken freshly roasted.
I will come back absolutely.
They offer catering too
column5: 48hrs in advance to place order.'

author: Joseph Gasque
text: 'Best Sandwich Ever!'

author: Nina Segura
text: 'Not the best food in town
column5: but acceptable and price was good'

author: Emmanuel Cort√©s Gonz√°lez
text: 'I used to work here loved their food'

author: Vlad Marom
text: 'Tomatoes were spoiled'

author: Jiaren Li
text: 'Very streamlined food ordering process
column5: but nevertheless great service and tasty food in nice portions. Good for takeout and delivery'

author: Chris Shimmin
text: "You walk in
column5: order your food and pay on a touch screen. You take your receipt and they  bring you your food when it's done. The food was awesome! Definitely going back."

author: Jonathan Shein
text: 'Great Chicken Pita sandwich and the flat bread platters are by far a winner. Outdoor seating is a plus and they deliver!'

author: Kyle Lukas
text: 'The chicken pita pota with red hot sauce is both delicious and cheap. The shephard salad is also great. Delivery took about a hour via seamless but that is expected.'

author: Matthew Goczalk
text: 'Good platters of marinated meats
column5: rice or split wheat
column8: and salad. Drinks are costly for what they are
column9: but pretty good deal for a lot of food in the platter.'

author: Julian Taborda
text: 'Plate was delicious and ingredients tasted fresh. Will definitely go again.'

author: Pink 25
text: "Husband and I had a chicken flat top platter with a side of humus and falafel along with a chicken pesto melt. Both were delicious and filling; even the side of fries I ordered with the melt were tastey. I ordered 2 more platters to take home for dinner. It's nice to finally have a place close by that offers up fresh authentic Mediterranean food."

author: Alison Gerver
text: 'So excited to have a place in town that has real quality products. The food is fresh and flavorful. The hummus is amazing! Great addition to Washington St!'

author: Matthew Hartsough
text: 'Ordered a chicken flat-top platter with chickpea salad
column5: brown rice
column6: and rosemary garlic thumb bread. Everything I ate tasted great
column7: I finished every last drop of food on my plate. Which leads to the downside of Flatbread Grill: portion size. The rice and chickpea salad were plentiful and the thumb bread is a nice size
column8: but there were only 4 small morsels of chicken in my dish. There should be at least two more for the $10 bill. I hope when I try Flatbread again the portion sizes are bigger and I can bump the review up to 4 stars. They also use computer screens to order which I think takes some of the personality away from the restaurant.'

author: George Calleros
text: 'Service is very pleasant. We sit outside for lunch and the servers bring your food and offer refills. Food is always delicious and unique flavors. Lunch is on the upwards of $12 so it can be pricey.'

author: William Colucci
text: 'Pleasant atmosphere
column5: music too loud though.  No wifi.'

author: Heath Miller
text: 'I had the gyro and it was great. Big portion and pita was superfresh.'
